definition: to get together
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和朋友們聚在一起，離開城市的喧囂。

sentences.english: acquaintances often gather to play for fun, with no wagering.
sentences.chinese: 熟人經常聚在一起打麻將玩，不下注。
我們總有一天能聚在一起。

sentences.english: The unlucky investors hang out together and drown their sorrows in a few drinks.
sentences.chinese: 一些歹運的投資人聚在一起藉酒澆愁。

sentences.english: Some like-minded people got together and set up a group.
sentences.chinese: 一些志趣相投的人聚在一起，成立了一個小組。

sentences.english: It is a rare chance for us to get together.
sentences.chinese: 難得我們有機會聚在一起。

sentences.english: People often gather for a party, appreciate chrysanthemums, pin the leaves of Cornus on clothes.
sentences.chinese: 人們經常聚在一起聚會，欣賞菊花，銷的葉子在衣服。

sentences.english: Everyone had gathered to say “GOOD-BYE” to the place where we had spent our schooldays.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都聚在一起，向我們度過校園生活的地方告別。

sentences.english: Oceanian Polynexiya had been shown specifically to cluster with Asia populations.
sentences.chinese: 大洋洲的波利尼西亞人與亞洲人羣聚在一起。

sentences.english: We had dumplings made by the whole family for dinner on lunar New Year's Eve ere.
sentences.chinese: 全家人聚在一起喫年夜飯是多麼幸福的事情。

sentences.english: All family members get together on New Year'Eve to have a big meal.
sentences.chinese: 所有家庭成員聚在一起在新年團年飯。

sentences.english: We gathered because we needed our grief to be witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 我們聚在一起是爲了讓我們的悲傷得到見證。

sentences.english: Do a few chamber pot quickly to us, we can gather again again.
sentences.chinese: 快給我們弄幾個尿盆來，我們又可重聚在一起了。

sentences.english: Today is grandma's 80th birthday, and all the family have got together to congratulate her.
sentences.chinese: 今天是奶奶的80壽誕，全家人聚在一起給奶奶祝壽。

sentences.english: In China, for example, tea is always served when people get together.
sentences.chinese: 例如，在中國，每當人們聚在一起的時候，都要上茶。

sentences.english: In the henhouse, all the chickens got together and were shivering.
sentences.chinese: 在雞舍裏，所有的雞聚在一起瑟瑟發抖。

definition: to sit in a circle/seated around (a narrator)
in groups of three or four (idiom)
party/gathering/to meet/to get together
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to chat/casual conversation
see 天南地北[tian1 nan2 di4 bei3]
in twos and threes
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
each other/mutually/mutual
to meet together/to assemble (of a group of people)
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
distant places/all over the country/(to talk) about this and that
to gather happily under one roof
to chat/idle gossip
to gather one's friends/to band together
